title: Health officials across Maryland working to get COVID-19 vaccine to where people are
body: Micro-targeted outreach of taking COVID-19 vaccine clinics to locations around Maryland is making it hard to say no to getting the vaccine and easier to say yes.|| COVID-19 updates | Maryland's latest numbers | Get tested | Vaccine Info ||Getting full approval from the Food and Drug Administration for the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine would be a major step in accessibility for the shot. FDA approval would make it easier for small medical practices and doctors to order vaccine supply for their practices, just like they would with the flu shot every year.Public health officials said making it easier to get the shot will help boost overall vaccination rates. And Health officials in Howard County and across Maryland are working to connect residents who have yet to get the vaccine by going where they are. Clinical staff and organizers call their roving pop-up clinic "a traveling circus."Maryland online vaccination site locatorVaccine Data DashboardMaryland vaccination plan FAQs"We try to fit everybody's schedule. Now, we're starting to do the more morning shifts, before people go to work.
